pullRequest.body:
Define induced containment of simple graphs.

From ExtrProbCombi (LeanCamCombi)

---

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsIndContained`
`+ IsIndContained.exists_iso_subgraph`
`+ IsIndContained.isContained`
`+ IsIndContained.of_exists_iso_subgraph`
`+ IsIndContained.of_isEmpty`
`+ IsIndContained.refl`
`+ IsIndContained.rfl`
`+ IsIndContained.trans`
`+ Iso.isIndContained`
`+ Iso.isIndContained'`
`+ Subgraph.IsInduced.isIndContained`
`+ complEquiv`
`+ compl_isIndContained_compl`
`+ isIndContained_iff_exists_iso_subgraph`
`+ isoSubgraphMap`
`+ isoToSubgraph`
`+ range_toSubgraph`
`+ toSubgraph`
`+ toSubgraph_surjOn`
`+ top_isIndContained_iff_top_isContained`
`+ âŸ¨IsIndContained.of_compl,`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#23090~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Can we get a data-valued equiv from this: something like "copies of A in B are in bijection with subgraphs of B isomorphic to A". That is, the equiv version of `toSubgraph` (then optionally make this iff from the bijection)
No we can't! There's a bijection only once you label the vertices of the subgraph. Otherwise, the `Copy` side accounts for the automorphisms of `G` while the `Subgraph` side doesn't
Ah, of course!

```suggestion
/-- A simple graph `G` is inducingly contained in a simple graph `H` if there exists an induced subgraph of `H`
```
This is induced containment not just containment!
(I don't love "inducingly contained" as a name, but I don't have better suggestions)
as before, can we have an equiv from graph embeddings to induced subgraphs of H iso to G
As before, nope
Do you want a one-field prop-valued structure? I don't have a strong preference
And do you want it to be a `class`? in which case I might as well make it an `abbrev`
Definitely not a class
Then I don't think I want it to be a one-field Prop-valued structure because that would mean it would take `âŸ¨âŸ¨fâŸ©âŸ©` to destruct it, instead of `âŸ¨fâŸ©`

```suggestion
  âŸ¨{ toFun := (â†‘)
     inj' := Subtype.coe_injective
     map_rel_iff' := hG'.adj.symm }âŸ©
```
We don't seem to use double spaces most of the time, although I see why you wanted to here
Oh in fact that's a choice mathport wanted for me (and recently I have witnessed that that's what the blue lightbulb wants for you too)
I'm not sure mathport's style choices are necessarily the ones we should follow in mathlib :)
This is the kinda thing I think `simp [Relation.map_apply_apply, f.injective]` should be able to do once we've given it the right simproc...
Actually it works already

```suggestion
/-- If `G` is isomorphic to `H`, then `G` is inducingly contained in `H`. -/
protected lemma Iso.isIndContained (e : G â‰ƒg H) : G âŠ´ H := âŸ¨eâŸ©
/-- If `G` is isomorphic to `H`, then `H` is inducingly contained in `G`. -/
protected lemma Iso.isIndContained' (e : G â‰ƒg H) : H âŠ´ G := e.symm.isIndContained
```

TODO: 
`(top : SimpleGraph V) âŠ´ H` iff `(top : SimpleGraph V) âŠ‘ H` (iff something about cliques too)
How do you want the clique lemma to be stated? I'm not sure myself
Me neither, you can just say "relate this to cliques" or something, if you like. And now that I think about it, induced containment of bot should relate to indep sets too
@eric-wieser do you remember the correct way to be changing copyright like this?
Let's keep the choice of variable names consistent between this line and the previous lines. I prefer `G,H` to `A,B`, what do you think?
I agree with you
The type variable choices here are weird...
Î²hat do you mean?

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
We denote "`G` is inducingly contained in `H`" by `G âŠ´ H` (`\triangle_left_eq`).
```
The induced version of this section docstring has more detail but this one basically just tells me "I am not induced", can we add a bit more here?
I was really confused, because I think you meant to comment on the next section doc instead
I don't think I do, I'm specifically complaining about the one about "Copies" (this one) being less useful than the ones about "Containment" and "Induced containment"
Ah, but this section is both about induced and non-induced copies, with the comment explaining that the induced stuff is already done somewhere else

```suggestion
@[trans] lemma IsIndContained.trans : G âŠ´ H â†’ H âŠ´ I â†’ G âŠ´ I := fun âŸ¨fâŸ© âŸ¨gâŸ© â†¦ âŸ¨g.comp fâŸ©
```

```suggestion
Relate `âŠ¥ âŠ‘ H` to there being an independent set in `H`.
```

pullRequest.title: feat(SimpleGraph): induced containment
